text: 2016 Edition 6% ABV : Deep hazy dark amber color with low activity. Faint creamy beige 2 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with average lace and weak legs. Flavors of caramel, ginger, nutmeg, pumpkins, plums, noble grains, molasses, herbal spices. Bready toffee gingerbread feel. Lots of sweetness, yet well balanced by the bold sharp spices. Slick oily medium body with prickly and soft crispy carbonation. Medium strength finish, slightly sour, lingering herbal and leafy dry hops, dense dark malts, with red ale kinda spices. Lacks freshness, a bit dull and flat. Perfect dose of spices, and its quite filling. Although with the last pour of yeast it was too intense. Tasty flavors, but feels overly alcoholic at 6%. Overall very good quality craft, with a bit of tweaking this one could be excellent. Representing well the style, though probably a step too rough.

750ml bottle. Fantastic, moderately cloudy, reddish amber colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white to beige head. Mellow, caramel malty aroma, fruity hints of mandarine and orange. Taste is moderately sweet caramel malty, hints of rock sugar, a touch of almond, marzipan, fruity hints of mandarine and orange, red berries, some rather plain hop bitterness.

De souvenir provenant dune dégustation non annotée. 
Apparence : Brune trouble, col beige, légère dentelle. 
Nez : Malt caramel, toasté, un peu de noisettes. 
Goût : Mêmes côtés caramélisés et grillés quau nez le tout accompagné dune belle présence de houblons herbacés et légèrement épicés. 
Sensation : Effervescence moyenne, corps mince à moyen. 
Bref : Rien de décoiffant, cette bière est tout de même bien réalisée intégrant très bien les saveurs du malt et des houblons allemands. Bel équilibre somme toute.

Une biere ambrée, avec peu deffervescence et une fine mousse. Au nez cest assez discret, avec une impression de caramel et de fruits confis. En bouche, la rondeur de la bière est vraiment intéressante. Le caramel et la levure de marzen sont présents, avec un petit côté épicé qui mintéresse beaucoup. Cest un genre de bière sous-brassé au Québec mais jaime bien le résultat final que nous offre LTM.

Pours a nice size foamy and creamy head and has a hazy amber appearance. Lacing is a bit weak. Aromas are quite malty and has a bit of earthy hops. Flavours have a bit of caramel and toffee in the mix but theres mainly cereal malts at the forefront. Mouthfeel has a bit of an astringent and tingling feel. Not too bad. Seems like a bit of saltiness in there, a bit odd. Not too bad but not the oktoberfest kinda beer I would drink for an extended part of time. After this 750ml bottle, Ive had plenty.

750ml bottle. Hazy copper with a foamy beige head. Flavors are bread toasted cereals, biscuit caramel, dried fruits and earth with nutty and herbal notes. Cloying sweetness, a bit syrupy/medicinal. Medium body, good carbonation, oily texture.

Belle robe ambrée claire surmonté dun col de mousse moyennement dense. Arômes de caramel, toffee, malts allemands bien perceptibles. Beaucoup de grain et gazon. Un peu de levures épicées. Le malt pils se démarque en arrière-plan. En bouche, malt caramelisé et légèrement rôti. Les houblons apportent une touche bien herbacée. Peu fruitée sauf des saveurs amères et épicées de zestes dagrumes. Texture légère et corps assez mince. Une lager oktoberfest malté dans le respect du style.
Not bad. I have to say that I am not particularly a fan of this style. Nice hoopy aspect is well balanced with the malts.

Dunkler, würzig hopfiger Antrunk mit karamelligem Aroma. Mild herb, das Malz wird intensiver und steigt parallel zur Herbe. Lang anhaltender Nachgeschmack, mild bitter, etwas fruchtig. 11/12/11/11/9/11

Bottle. Pours unclear golden in color with a whitish head. Malty, quite fresh bready notes actually, some sweetness and hints of grassy bitterness in aroma. Bit of grassy bitterness in taste too, feels quite soft though, which is nice. A refreshing beer for this occassion.

Clear copper pour with lots of pillowy head that leaves a little lace. Lots of bready notes with some roasted character, light toffee. Theres something floral about this as well. Mostly the same on the palate. Finishes slightly sweet with a good malt flavour. Impressive for the style.

Prost! I could have this beer everyday, I see why they brew it specifically for getting thrashed at a beer festival, its remarkably drinkable. Nothing fancy but super tasty and refreshing. Hazy brown orange with a thin, crisp head. Notes of caramel, burnt toffee, toasted malts and cereal smack the sniffer. Very tiny hop smell and flavour, a smooth and dry finish to boot. Should be drinking this from a boot actually. Germans sure make Lagers not suck. Even though this is Quebecois. But yknow. Vive le Quebec Li-biere!

Pours a clear medium coppery amber with one fingers of loose beige head diminishing rapidly to a thin skim, no lacing. Nose is caramel malt, honey, herbal and floral hops. Taste is caramel and bready malt, with a little spice and a slight nuttiness. Light to medium body, somewhat slick, sustained prickly carbonation, and a mildly bitter (20 IBU) finish.

Decently drinkable but for it being quite sweet and malty - its almost a honey brown. (I dont think I could handle more than one of these.) Not bad, certainly, and very appropriate for cooler weather - but I have to admit Im continuing to consistently rank lagers toward the lower end of my personal preference. In this case, I think Id be happier with a little more robustness and spice, and a little less caramel malt.
Great looking brown amber, with a fading head. Nice and malty, caramel, almost maple. Taste is bitter, but still malty.pretty tasty. Finish is a little dry. Good beer overall.

Literally, my review of this beer can just about be summed up with the review directly below mine. I get all the same aromas/tastes, although theres this funky sort of barnyard element that lingers through the finish, and Im not sure whether I like it or not. Otherwise the finish is subtly, but noticeably dry. For 21 IBU and 6.4% alcohol, this stuff is amazingly quaffable.

Pours a hazy amber with a big frothy off white head. Aroma is of caramel, herbs, honey, and floral hops. Tastes of caramel, sugar, banana, booze, and even those hallertau hops. Has a medium body with low carbonation. This beer is smooth, slick and refreshing, would make a very good session beer in my opinion.

Aroma is a subtle earthiness, clove, and light caramel, and roasted malts. Taste is a bold bitterness up front but mellows nicely with a well balanced sweet roasty maltiness. Appearance is a hazy orange / amber with a thin pearl head that retains poorly

Une belle couleur cuivrée avec un col assez résistant. Au nez au percois très bien la levure pilsner, les céréales et une petite touche fruité. En bouche levure pilsner,céréales sucré meme un peu trop avec une petite touche fruité. Cest mal balancé, une petite touche sucré qui est dans la plupart des bières de LTM que je napprécie pas beaucoup. Corps moyen, Carbonation moyenne. Un gros boff pour moi.

Une belle robe cuivrée et orangée remplit le verre et est surmontée dune mousse généreuse. Au niveau des arômes, les oranges confites et le sucre dorge dominent. Cet aspect sucré se répète en bouche et sagence au goût très prononcé des céréales, elles aussi sucrées. Un peu mince, mais néanmoins délicieuse.

All caramel in the aroma. In the taste the caramel sweetness is overpowering. As the beer warms some buttery notes come forward as well. A coppery red colour with a fizzy white head. Light to medium bodied and a sweet after taste remains. For me this beer leans too far to the sweet side to be really enjoyable.

Brown bottle, 750 ml, produced in 08/2012, savoured on April 4 2014; eye: auburn, hazy, tiny sheet of beige head that turns into a tiny ring, slight lacing; nose: malt, caramel, slight nutty; mouth: malt, caramel, slight nutty, light acridness, a bit tired, finale in malt with presence of acridness, medium-light body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, thin; overall: ordinary

FRANÇAIS
	
Bouteille brune, 750 ml, 6 %, produite 08/2012, savourée le 4 avril 2014; il : châtain, voilée, petit couverture de mousse beige qui se transforme en un mince anneau, très légère dentelle; nez : malt, caramel, très léger noix; bouche : malt, caramel, très léger noix, légère âcreté, finale en malt avec présence dâcreté, corps moyen-léger, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, mince; en résumé : ordinaire

Belle bière rousse au-dessus de laquelle se hisse une mousse blanche généreuse et tenace. Nez de sucre dorge, de grains, avec un peu de petits fruits rouges. En bouche, cest goûteux et effervescent. Belle texture. Le caramel ressort sans aucun doute, de même que le malt. Bière assez traditionnelle mais qui me semble dépourvue de défauts majeurs. La légère amertume est bien balancée par le sucre. Cheers!

On cask at Beaus Oktoberfest. Light mahogany with a an off white thin head. Was getting towards two sheets to the wind at this point but was a fairly mallty nose, low carbonation, moderate body, easy to drink, some roasted toffee and a soothing finish. I am not usually a fan of 3M beers and remember thinking that this was actually decent.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 Bière orangée cuivrée, bien voilée, très bonne effervescence, et surmontée dune copieuse mousse brunâtre, très dense, cotonneuse même, et qui trace son chemin sur les parois de la chope. Arômes bien maltée de pain grillé, grain rôti, caramel et sucre dorge. Présence au nez également dun houblon floral et poivré, et dun petit quelque chose rappelant les petits fruits rouges, ou peut-être davantage les bonbons aux fruits et la réglisse rouge. Beau nez bien agréable, belle complexité, mais intensité plutôt moyenne cependant. En bouche, pétillement plutôt élevé sur la langue, onctuosité intéressante au palais, belle rondeur. Au goût, dabord très maltée en bouche, à la fois dans les céréales (grains rôtis, pain grillé) et dans les sucres (caramel, sucre dorge), et on retrouve cette subtile saveur de bonbon aux fruits rouge, de réglisse rouge. Cette entrée maltée est savamment équilibrée par un houblon floral et légèrement poivré qui mène à une finale à lamertume bien sentie malgré un IBU annoncé à seulement 20. Très bonne bière, goûteuse, savoureuse et bien intense en bouche, belle complexité. Excellent pour un festival! [Note : Jachète cette bière à toutes les années depuis au moins 4 ans, et, je ne sais pas si cest moi, mais je trouve que les deux derniers brassins (2014 et 2015) étaient un peu plus faibles. Goût de grain un peu plus grossier, moins raffiné, et alcool un peu mal intégré]

bottle. Poured hazy red-amber with a thin off white head. Nutty malt nose. Medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel. Moderately sweet brew. Flavours of toasted malt, caramel notes with an earthy hop presence and finishes just a touch astringent. A really nice beer.

Couleur cuivre.
nez herbassé sent les grains.
en bouche:grains frais,herbacée,sec avec une finale peu amêre.

À lapparence, lOktoberfest de LTM ressemble et sent comme une brune ; la bouteille dont jhérite est madérisée, malgré le fait que je sois encore dans la limite de conservation de 12 mois. Au nez donc, pruneaux, bois, caramel. En bouche, le tout se mélange et lon constate quelle a plutôt mal vieillie : vin rouge, boisé âcre, notes de caramel brûlé et de fruits confits. Pas mauvaise quand on passe par-dessus ses défauts de vieillissement, ce que je me suis efforcé de faire.
de couleur cuivre avec  mousse banche. des aromes malt cuivre avec une pointe amertume (rate 76)

750ml brown bottle that is corked and caged, from the LCBO. Production date: 01/08/2012. Pours a slightly hazy golden-amber colour with an off-white head, that is big, frothy, long-lasting and with foamy lacing. Aromas of bread, with some caramel malt, figs and other dark fruits. Medium-bodied with a silky smooth mouthfeel. The taste is a decent mix of the malts, fruits and mild hops. Grainy cereal malt, sweet toffee and the hops just mildly drying off the finish. This is quite a nice Oktoberfest.

Pours a manukah honey orange with a thin white cap. The aroma is grassy, herbal, light biscuit, cardboard, and caramel malts. Flavour reflects even everything in the aroma with a long lightly spicey finish accented by the caramel malts.

Pours amber with a frothy off-white head. Aroma is of citrus and toasty malt - really nice. The taste is toasty, biscuity malt, with a clean, medium body, and a light hop finish. Really well-balanced and interesting take on this style!
Rencontre brève et sans grand éclat, croustillante, léger biscuit, peu de végétaux, sur le style.

2012 Vintage 
750ml corked/caged bottle 
6.0% ABV 
Atrium on Bay LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
November 30, 2012 
Bottled August 1, 2012 
The beer pours a sollid copper colour, slightly hazed, with a thin tan head.  Aroma is light fruits, grains, and hops.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.  Flavour is caramel, light fruits, sweet malt, and grains.  A very nice tasting beer.
Bouteille de 750ml, robe rousse ambrée, arôme de caramel, goût de caramel également et belle amertume pour balancer le tout.

This lager poured a deep copper colour with a creamy, yellowish head. Nice lacing. Scents include dough, grass, earthy and light toast. First sip was very creamy with nice mild carbonation. Flavours of caramel, toast and cereal. finish is sweet and malty.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy orange-brown with a whole lot of foamy tan head. Smell is spicy and sweet, some cloves and some sweet cereal, though not very pronounced. Palate is fairly light, with some carbonation, but not a whole lot. Taste is a bit sweet at first with a tiny bit of spiciness, but then gives way to a good bitterness which gets more intense as time goes on. Aftertaste is long lasting bitterness. Not bad.

Served in a 1L dimpled stein. :D Apperance: Cloudy orange brown, huge white head that slowly dissipates. Aroma: Very spicy. Notes of cloves, cinnamon, paprika. Palate: Medium bodied, smooth, slightly dry lingering finish, but not as harsh as most oktoberfests. Taste: sweet start, fairly savoury middle, slightly bitter in the finish. Im not a huge oktoberfest fan, but I quite enjoy this variation.

It pours auburn with copper highlights; the head is off-white and soapy. The aroma has notes of: prunes, walnuts, and lemon-zest. The taste is mostly dry with some bitterness; there are notes of: walnuts, alcohol, and light grapefruit. The palate is medium-light bodied, water, low carbonation, and medium finish. Overall, its alright, though Oktoberfest beers are not my style.

750 mL bottle.  Pours a dark, cloudy orange colour with a lasting white head.  Subtle aroma, picking up a distinct squash/vegetable scent, honey and black tea.  Taste is mildly sweet with a lagery clean finish, barely hopped.  Clean with medium body and palate.  Enjoyed.

750 ml bottle (2012 edition at 6%) from LCBO.  Pours a murky dark orange with average-sized cream-coloured head.  Aroma is slightly toasty caramel, spice and a light grassiness.  Flavour is more pronounced with sweet, slightly toasty caramel, fruit, grassy/herbal bitterness and a gentle pepper spiciness.  Fine, somewhat lively carbonation.  Medium plus body.  Good though not super exciting.

2012 bottle (6% abv) from LCBO.  Pours hazy copper with a huge continuously growing head.  Aroma of caramel and noble hops.  Taste is caramelly sweet, some spicy hops (pepper), with a slight bitterness.  Nice body.  A good Oktoberfest beer!

2012 version

Aroma is dominated by sweet malt tones - caramel and bready. Beer is hazy (bottle conditioned), colour is a nice pink-ish bronze. Thin head, but well carbonated. Taste goes from medium sweetness to lingering alcohol and metallic flavours, momentarily interrupted by a very crisp finish. The beer is tingly in the mouth from high carbonation. Overall an interesting beer.

2012 version. Pours a nice light copper colour, a little cloudy for an Octoberfest.  Nice off white creamy head although it didnt last too long.  Clean pilsner malt in the nose giving me fresh baked baguette, some caramel hints, no discernible strong hop aroma, maybe a hint of floral hops (Hallertau Im guessing).  Malt forward profile in terms of flavour, slight nuttiness and caramel toastiness.  subtle hop bitterness in the finish, which is moderately dry.  Well carbonated which curtails the finish a little and makes me want more sooner :-)  Overall very well crafted beer, unlike many of the Oktoberfest beers I am used to (although I have learned that the real Oktoberfest beer served in Munich during the festival is not the dark and very malty versions that seem to be common in North America).  Nice bottle (havent seen many O beers in a 750ml corked bottle).  Definitely worth trying.

Smells super malty. A good dose of swampiness. The beer pours super red and cloudy with alittle lacing. Theres a little spice in the aroma but I find myself struggling to see any real character in this beer. Theres a little honey as well. An easy to drink session beer though, and I guess thats the idea here. On tap at volos.

Le liquide est cuivré et est très bien garni en ce qui concerna la mousse. Une dentelle se dessine de façon inégale. Maltée au nez, des effluves de poussières de grain en émanent, comme si on se trouvait tout près dune moissonneuse-batteuse. En bouche elle est épicée, avec une touche fruitée, alors que sajoute un amalgame de sucre et dherbes qui semble interférer avec les premières impressions. Elle laisse une douce amertume appréciable. Je ne lui trouve pas de qualités exceptionnelles, mais, avec de la saucisse et de la choucroute, cétait un excellent complément. (date de production 08-2012) (382-021012)

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur brun ambrée rappelant le scotch, mousse beige dense et riche. Arôme de céréales, de malt légèrement rôtis, de houblon et de caramel. Goût de céréales, de houblon, de caramel avec une légère amertume. Texture riche, carbonation faible.

[bottle--didnt notice any "S.S.", but 2012]
Scotch tape and faint farmhouse aroma with some melanoidiny spiciness. Hazy bronze under a tan-orange ring. Spicy melanoidins and assertively bitter flavour with a dry finish, though the start was sweet. One sided with bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation (too much), moderately bitter finish.
Bottle 750 ml. Pours hazy caramel brown with redish reflect. Frothy white head, Nice lacing. Aroma and flavour: caramel malt, lager yeast, apple must. Nice balance. A bit thin.

Bottle (750 ml). Dark amber with a medium off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is grass/herbal with a malty presence and some hops. Taste is grassy with slight biteerness and some acidic notes. Good for the style.

750 ml bottle/2012;amber(copper)color,taste is dried-up caramel with a head that lasted the 20 minutes needed.
having enjoyed many 3m bieres,expected just a little more .

Bottle 750ml. [2012]
Pours dark amber with good off-white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of malt, caramel. Taste is of malt, caramel, sligth acidity. Overall: A fair beer.

750 ml bottle, 2012 edition. Pours a hazy orange brown amber with a thick, long-lasting beige-orange head. Smells like grains and caramel. Extremely malty taste. Dry caramel, cereals, biscuits, toffee. More bitter than I was expecting, herbal. Barley candy taste in the finish, too. Medium to full bodied, somewhat sticky. It was good, but I remembered last years version being lighter, more accessible and, Id say, somewhat better tasting...oh well, still pretty good, though!

Very tasty Oktoberfest beer with a strong roasted malt taste and some spicy notes. Low on alcohol but big on taste. Rating it from the bottle but also tried it on tap at the Oktoberfest des Quebecois for which it was brewed.

pours copper-red, slight haze, with a nice off-white head, good retention and lacing. lightly roasted malts, nutty, earty and dusty, big grassy hops, light tartness, dry fruitiness, hint of sweetness, peppery. soft carbonation, medium body, short to medium long citrusy finish.

Wow, really surprised at how much I like this one. Pours a very hazy dark amber with a small head that just leaves a white bubble layer on top. Very grainy, somewhat biscuit malty, but it leaves nice hop bitterness behind. Medium carbonation. Really nice!

Pours reddish. Hazy. Fastest disappearing head ever. Aroma is somewhat biscuity and slightly hoppy. Hops are actually quite distinguishable in this one. Otherwise, some notes of caramel and apple. A bit overcarbonated. Solid offering... Terrific offering by a sunny, october day!

750 ml bottle (vintage 2011) purchased at La Saucisserie BDF in Bois-des-Filion (Quebec), on August 21, 2011. Reddish hazy, small head. Spicy aroma of malted barley sweetness, hints of berries. Taste of herbs and malty greens, slightly sweet, surprising good bitterness. Very nice, especially this season!

750mL corked bottle poured a hazy amber color with orange hues and a big white head and some lacing.  Aromas of toasted malts and some fruit.  Taste is malty sweet with some hops coming through in the end.  A truly enjoyable beer.

2011 bottle. Pour copper amber off white head decent lace. Aroma earthy, soil, floral hops, spice, slight nuttiness. Taste nutty, floral, earthy, spice, caramel, decent bitter balance. MF medium body good carb. Really solid flavorful session brew easy drinking and flavorful.

Bottle, split with mcberko. Pours cloudy orange / red with a thick, lasting head. Aroma of spices, apples cider and yeast. Flavour of spices, herbs, vegetables and yeast. Thin, over-carbonated, like soda water.

750mL bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours hazy bright orangey amber with a beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, spices, nuts and sort of a vegetable quality. Flavour is quite mild, with toasted malt, nuts and that same mild vegetable quality. Pretty dull / weak.
Deep brown lager with a good collar. Aromas of hop and caramel. Great balanced taste. Pertfect with ribs.

Belle bière ambrée et trouble, sous un ample col beige laissant une dentelle au verre.  Des arômes légèrement lactés de résine et de caramel.  Belle amertume complexe, très peu sucrée.  Effervescence moyenne, et longue finale amère.  Bue au match #1 Mtl-Bos 2011...

Poured out a deep rusty amber with a large fluffy chunky tan head with some lacing. Tons of malt aroma - caramel,  grass, toffee, touch of earth, toast, raw grain. The taste is decent being pretty much all malts with a sneaky mild hop on the finish. None of this west coast crap either. I really dig how the hops are working here considering that this is typically a style that Im not overly impressed by. Tons of malts obviously - a bit earthy, tons of toast, more underlying hops that have gained some ground without ruining this beer, some sweetness. Good carbonation and a light feel lends to easily drinking this whole bottle. Solid malts throughout. Raw nut on the finish. I likedish.

750 ml bottle.  Pours orangey -copper in colour, with medium caramel tinged head.  Aroma and taste are slightly sweet munich or vienna type malt, with moderate amount of German hopping.  Very nice Oktoberfest, very drinkable.  Gotta get some more!

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Dirty amber colour with a MASSIVE head.  Random bits of lacing around the stein. Fantastic aroma.  Earthy Malts with a blast of German Noble Hops.  Fresh bread, spices....  Dry malts and a musty flavor followed by a big blast of German hops and the signature LTM taste (their yeast?).   The very definition of Liquid Bread.  Note:  Grab this one FRESH!  Had it again 5 months later and still rated in the high threes, but a Fresh bottle is the way to go.

Needed a dark sweet lager for some shortribs I was cooking, and this fit the bill nicely. 2 cups for the ribs, 1 cup for me. Bottle. Pours hazy tawny brown, thick off-white head sticks around, and laces wonderfully. Nose is full of soft fruit, caramel, sticky toffee, light hop spiciness, MacIntosh toffee. Flavours are full and rich, nice mouthfeel, good balance between fruit and malt, spiciness is apparent but never dominating. Yeah, I dig this.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2012 ALTERNATE RATE 2012, about 6 per cent I think. some nice crisp malts and rounded pale fruits, some grapey fruits typical of LTM, good rich-dry palate, finish sticky-crisp and a little winey, good unusual interpretation 3.6  //Big bottle with cork and cage from Peluso. The SS of Oktoberfest beers... um unfortunate name but OK. Reddy look with white head. Aroma is bready with fruit. Taste is crisp and fruity with some red berry, apple, and grape. Really nice spicy finish, carries some dry hop, caramel and a little mineral. Not a German beer by any wild stretch but another tasty Trois Mousquetaires freak show. 3.7 ~ you 
wednesday, january 26, 2011
Bière officielle du festival oktoberfest des québécois de mascouche du 10au12 septembe 2010, 4.1% dalcool, lager rousse peu mousseuse, saveur de caramel, houblon allemand.

Deep amber color with large bubbles. Bready with a touch of caramel. Not really that well balanced, which I think partially has to do with the low ABV. Decent enough seems more aimed at the mainstream crowd than craft beer lovers, but price doesnt reflect this.

750ml bottle série signature, dark amber color, with a fluffy beige head, but falls quickly, earthy grainy toasted, biscuity, caramel malt nose with a hint of floral herbal hop accent, and green vegetable aroma reminiscent of the frontenac québécois malt, folows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice crisp earthy toasted, biscuity, caramel, grainy, cereal malt character with a greenish vegetable note, marked the well known québécois malt fontenac again, with some faint toffee, young almond, peanut bitterness undertones, with a flowery raw leafiness, leading towards an earthy grainy malty, vegetable, lingering grassy ho bittering finish.

Bottle, shared with Rockley. Hazy orange amber, generous golden bubbly head with impressive staying power and lacing. Sweet toffee and green hop aroma, reminds me of alfalfa for some weird reason. Nice toffee malt flavour with solid grassy hop finish. Really tasty.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: A reddish amber beer with a thick moka head. A pleasant grassy malt aroma with chalky notes. In mouth, a smooth crisp biscuitty malt with classic German hops, grassy and fragrant, freshly made, classy. On tap at Octoberfest des Quebecois, Sept. 12 2010

Looks great!! Pours reddish amber with a thick beige head. aroma is dull and malty. vienna malt dominates the palate. lots of caramel and malty sweetness. Great mouth feel very tasty brew. Dry hopy finish this is the perfect beer for fall.

Brassin 2010, 4,1 %.  Le liquide versé dévoile une teinte cuivrée.  A priori, la mousse est épaisse.  Quelques traces collées sont observables.  Les parfums des grains maltés prennent toute la place en affichant des notes justement grillés et légèrement piquantes.  Le goût est collé aux arômes : le grain est très présent, les houblons insaisissables avec une amertume modérée à faible.  En bouche, le liquide est de moyenne corpulence avec une effervescence appropriée et une texture légèrement crémeuse.  La finale est en accord avec le style, cest-à-dire maltée avec une réponse adéquate de notes amères de houblons.  En résumé, la version actuelle est aussi appréciable que les précédentes.  Une autre performance solide des Trois Mousquetaires.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Floral, rosebuds aroma. Amber colour, beige head, good lace. Sweetish, bitter, hint of toffee, rosebud in the finish. Dry tongue. Not bad but hard to drink though IMO.

750 mL bottle.  (2008 vintage).  Cola-brown with a small, short-lived, brown head.  Big, lovely, malty aroma.  The most dominant scent is anise, and as such, this puts me in mind of a dubbel.  The flavour is malty, earthy, and has a bitterness to it that lacks any sort of distinctive hop presence.  A nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2011 Bouteille 750 ml. 4.1%. Édition 2010. Couleur ambrée-orange. Arôme de caramel et malt. Goût de caramel, un peu de fruits. Assez présente en bouche. Finale avec une très légère amertume. Édition 2011 à lOktoberfest des Québécois. Très bonne encore.

Very decent drinking beer, sent to me from all places Alberta and Presario.  Pours a good sized head, creamy mouthfeel.  Carbonation right there,a good lager.  No smoke detected.Neutral aroma, and a little complexity between some bitterness and malts.
Dark Amber red poor with large white head.  Herbal nose with some malt and caramel notes. Taste is sweet caramel with moderate amout of hop. I really enjoyed this quite complex flavored beer

Very hazy amber-red pour with a thick sticky white head.  The nose is a little bit nutty with a bit of light yeastiness.  Sort of an herbal hoppy aroma.  Flavour is softly sweet with a kiss of herbal hoppiness.  As it warms it opens up a really lovely crackery malt sweetness.  Chewy and fairly sweet with more herbal hoppiness than would be considered typical.  Despite these oddities, its a really impressive beer.

750 ml bottle from Trappe a Fromage, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. OC 23/09.
App.:  Bright ruby copper with a large reddish-tan head.
  
Aroma:  Strong vegetal, wet cigar ash; if you dig, theres some dried fruit and molasses, a little brown sugar, kinda nasty.
  
Palate:  Medium body and moderate carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Some berries, a little dark dried fruit, some minty molasses, still some nasty wet ash and a vegetal note, a little peppery; kinda sweet with fair bitterness and a frozen peas finish, not good.

An unexpectedly poor failure.  Might try a second bottle.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2009 Bottle 750 ml 2009 edition shared with a friend on 09.09.12 : Brown in color this one is opaque. It has a floral nose I taste raisins fallowed by caramely/ roasty notes.  The yeast is clean and pleasant. A decent brew.

2009 batch with a light blue label; 6,29$ for 750 ml.  Cerealish malt, nothing sweet nor fruity in there.  Its very dry and has an intense taste of wood, grass, haystack, with distant smokey notes.  Theres maybe something a little too nasty (and intense) in the taste to be the official beer of the coming Oktoberfest in Mascouche.  Im not sure this beer will be very appreciated by the crowds.  It is pretty harsh, my (beer-open-minded) girlfriend hated it and, even if the quality is unarguably present, it is still not so pleasant to drink for me.

Pours a deep hazy red with a prominent light tan head.  Pleasant aroma, grainy with a hint of caramel.  This beer feels good on the palate, thick, slightly syrupy with nice carbonation.  Taste is a complex blend of mild woodiness, sweet caramel notes, and a touch of burnt/roasted malt flavors.  Finishes on the bitter side as it leaves the tongue...very interesting and well done!

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2009 2009 version, 750ml bottle. Brown pour with a cream head. The aroma is much maltier and earthier than the last oktoberfest rousse I tried which used to be pretty grassy really quite muddy limestone a bit of yeast. You get more hops in the taste which is a little bit herbal spicy yeasty and starchy malts. Mouthfeel is smooth very tasty and a good lasting finale. I prefered the old one but this one is nice.
Pours brownish red.  Spice and hop in the nose.  Small bitterness in the taste.  Taste is hop, malt and spice.  Really nice finish with this beer.

Bottle - 750ml. Pours a hazy brown body with average carbonation and a thick, lasting beige foamy head. Enjoyable and complex malty/hoppy aroma with spicy, yeasty and grainy hints. Its robust taste carries some plummy notes and ends with a decent bittersweet finish. Well done!

[2007-20090219] 750mL bottle. Spicy heavy yeast aroma with lots of grains and dusty plastic, some boiled brussels sprouts, wet/mild smoke and creamed corn. Hazy, amber brown body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. More grainy chocolate and creamed corn and brussels sprouts flavour with light earthy lima beans. Medium body. Very odd aroma but surprisingly interesting.
(c/o garthicus a.k.a. garthicxnt, w/ him, blankboy, GregClow, HogTownHarry, jerc)

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2010 Clear russet. Lasting off-white foam. As is often the case with Trois Mousquetaires, were dealing with a perfectly clean offering and one that is tasty also. Its maltiness immediately takes a toasty orientation, nuanced by almond, bread crust and sesame seeds nuances while soft leafy hops procure minute bitterness. Very clean and agile malt profile, but somehow not as full-flavoured as previous vintages. The carbonation is a bit less vivacious, making the ensemble a bit less lively, apparently less dry. Still, amongst Quebec lagers, this is a sure value, just not quite the paramount refreshment/taste compromise it might have been in the last 2 years.  In 2010, this dropped down to an all-time low 4.1%. The slightly hazy amber pour wears a fine white head. Despite its lightness, its toasty aromas are not subtle at all, complementing the leafiness from the hops nicely and feeling a tad more mineral than your average lager. Earthy notions render the ensemble more complex, nuancing the breadiness with rooty, flowery touches. Easy to drink and light-bodied, it nevertheless proposes a rather crisp texture that makes it engaging. Previous score was 3.4, bumping up to 3.5.
Bottle. Can smell the rich malt as soon as you pour. Cloudy orange-copper. Thick malty peppery body. Tasty thick spicy flavour. Heavy malt.

Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, garthicus, GregClow, jerc & mabel -- c/o garthicus. Pours a hazy orange-amber with an average size creamy off-white head. Odd aroma is vegetal, like squash or mashed green peas, along with caramel malt. Flavour of caramel malt, slightly toasty, along with some fruit and light herbal hops. Average to medium bodied. A pretty odd beer -- not bad, not great -- just odd.
750ml bottle. From notes. Poured amber, brownish fluffy head. Aroma is prunes, dry fruits. Taste is like aroma. Ok beer but not really my type. Rating #63

2009-02-19. Hazy reddish brown body with a modest tan head. (3+) Odd aroma is herbal/vegetal and doesnt really warrant further investigation, mild note of cigarette butt. Flavour has similar earthy herbal notes to the hops, sweet malt base is tough to pull out. Average plus palate is lightly carbonated. Im done here. Odd. Disappointing offering from a brewery that has done much better in the past. Bottle shared by Garthc*nticus

750ml Bottle shared with Pyroziod and French Tickler.  Hazy copper appearance with a taned bubblely head.  Aroma: butter scotch, caramel, hops and vanilla.  Flavor:  caramel, brown sugar, hops, cherry and vanilla.  Palate: medium body, nice thick mouth feel with an oily finish.

Bottle (750ml).  Shared by garthicus with me, bllankboy, gregclow, jerc and mabel. Hazy coppery-amber, average creamy tan lasting head.  Very pungent aroma - I cant decide - I get beets, peat, canola, alcohol ...  Taste - grainy, a little sweeter, still funky and earthy.  Average body, solid carbonation, long pungent finish - odd, a little non-smooth.

Appearance: Nice ruby hazy colour, thick pancake mix colour head. Aroma: Boiled Brussels sprouts, hops, cabbage? Beets? Whats going on? Flavour: Spice, hops, malt, vegetal,   odd. Not bad, just odd. It works but its difficult to describe..

Acheté au jovi en format de 750ml et dégusté dans un verre tulipe de dieu du ciel. De couleur brune orangé malté au reflet ambré avec peu de mousse collant bien au vere. Arômes de malt fumé,caramel, noisette, orange et muscade. Le tout est très floral et équilibré avec une légère touche de framboise et de cerise en post-olfaction. Gustativement dès la première gorgée fût une heureuse rencontre entre le sucré et lamertume. Un léger goût de réglisse, de fûmé, dépices, de mûres et dhoublon. Une bière très bien balancé et nuancé avec un petit " je ne sais quoi " de grandiose.

Bottle courtesy of beergeek, shared at the first KW tasting.  Odd vegetable aroma - hard to describe, but it did nothing for me.  Amber pour, small white head.  Sharp taste - hoppy, malty, fruit, some vegetable and earthy notes as well.  Ok.  Hmm, not sure why, but I just did not dig this one.

Bouteille 750ml. De couleur ambrée foncée et voilée. Nez malté de caramel légèrement rôti, de houblon floral et moyennement terreux, moyen de noix, léger de pain grillé et  avec des notes de fruits (raisins) et des traces de fumée de bois. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement crémeuse et légèrement huileuse. Goût moyennement amer de houblon floral et terreux (présent toute la gorgée) accompagné dun léger goût fruité (raisins, traces de petits fruits) et de traces de légumes bouillis lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût malté de caramel, de grains légèrement rôti et aux notes terreuses ainsi qu un moyen goût de pain grillé puis en finale lon retrouve un regain damertume asséchante de houblon plus terreux et aux notes herbeuses ainsi qu un léger goût de noix et des notes boisées (fumée de bois). Post-goût long-moyen et plutôt sec, moyennement amer de houblon terreux, moyennement floral et légèrement herbeux avec un léger goût de rôti, des notes de noix, de fruits (moût de raisins) et boisées.

750 ml bottle brought by jay to our first KW group tasting at tupalevs. hazy amber pour with a mis sized off white head. the aroma reminded me so much of the inside of a pumpkin. i basically didnt shut up about this the whole time we were drinking this brew, sorry guys i was just really excited about the pumpkin guts. also there was some nice pale malt aspects. the flavour was decent, overly vegetal but not unenjoyable. very funky and weird interpretation of the style. im gla this brew had being lagered because there was a lot that really could have gone in the wrong direction but the lagering smooth everything out into a drinkable form. im glad i got to try this brew and it stood out from the other we had. thanks for sharing jay.

750ml shared at Tupalevs, big thanks to whoever brought this! Pours a beautiful hazy amber with a medium white head. Aroma is HUGE on the Earthiness, like big time, with some nice Munich malts in there too. The flavour is even better, extremely bitter for a lager, loads of hops, like I said very Earthy and herbal, astringent. Balanced well with the sweet Munich malts, but the bitterness steals the show. Simple but highly enjoyable. Might be the most flavourful lager Ive ever had, and a style that I would kill to get more examples of. Its a travesty that in KW, with the largest Oktoberfest outside of Germany, you cant find any real Oktoberfest beers. Its pathetic actually. But this one was quite a treat!

Bottle: Poured a deep copper color Marzen with a light brown color foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry caramel malt is sublime. Taste is also a well balance mix between some lightly sweet malt notes with hints of fresh caramel and some minimal hops presence. Full body with great carbonation and easily quaffable. Definitely geared toward the malt lover but still easily drinkable.

In short: A dirty fruity amber lager of some kind. A bit off and strange but quite drinkable. How: Bottle 750ml. Many times. This rating for a 2 or 3 months bottle. The look: Cloudy dirty dark red body topped by a small beige head In long: Nose of baked red fruits. Full body, lively carbonation. Lots of earthy malts, red fruits of all kinds, grapes, caramel, wet campfire wood, a little red grapes sourness that should not be there (imho). A lot of woody and earthy hops. A strong overall dirt sensation like wet earth or something. Strange brew. Dirtier than a punk bar toilet after a open-bar night.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2009 Poured a deep orange red clouded lager in the stein with a massive puffy white cap. Magnificent lacing on the glass

Aroma is a magnificent  musty, earthy woodsy blast of German noble hops with a decent toasted malt rib.

Big chew on bready toasty amber Munich malts up front but this is quickly joined by a massive infusion of German noble varieties making this a German noble hop bomb with a rigid Munich amber malt spine. Absolutely glorious!!!;  Woody earthiness outbalances the thick bready core to the finish where light bittering takes over.

Great Teutonic brew from a great brewer.

Bouteille de 750 ml. Nos yeux observent une bière de couleur rougeâtre avec un col de mousse fauve modeste et durable. Au nez on découvre des arômes de houblon floral et une touche de grain caramélisé torréfié. En bouche le corps est moyen avec une effervescence douce et crémeuse. On goûte des saveurs de sucre d’orge au départ, vient ensuite une légère torréfaction et le tout se termine par une amertume florale douce mais persistante.

The pour reveals a gorgeous cloudy amber color with a thick, frothy, beige head that lasts a long while. The aroma has a pleasant blend of earthy hops, malt, fruits and theres also a spicy something in there. The flavor is special, I ususally find biscuity malt in Oktoberfests, but in this one theres no biscuity flavors, it tends more to toasty, with fruits, earthy hops and again that spicy feeling, theres also bitterness in the end. The body has a medium thickness with a creamy, slightly oily texture and moderate carbonation. This Oktoberfest is unclean and unorthodox, and I like that!

My Bottom Line:
Minutious earthy hop waves brush a fruity toasted malt cove, as their spicy spindrift relentlessly poeticizes this distinguished unfiltered Märzen.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sturdy inch of foam stays atop the cloudy cherry red.
-The fruitiness is redolent of dried berries and raisins, as it delves into near-caramel sweetness.
-The malt character has a lot of personality, and as such may not emulate the usual Märzen, but who cares? This is beautifully drinkable and expertly crafted.
-The malts could be a tad crisper for my tastes.
-The peaceful big bubbles complement the comfortable body, increasing drinkability.
-A slight mineral character is perceived early on, but it is harder to perceive after a few gulps.
-That finish is really compelling!

Bottle.
bouteille de 750ml avec bouchon de liège, belle couleur brune claire, très claire, nez malté, dans le mile du style, agréable bouche fraiche, malté, j’aime beaucoup.

Verre de dégustation, provenant d’un fût, dégusté au festival Bières et Saveurs 2008 (Chambly, QC). Arôme: Odeur d’houblons avec une pointe de céréales et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée voilée. Présence d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût d’houblons et de céréales avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #1923)
